content: Where can I find the edge list of the implication graph?
You can download it in CSV form from equation explorer now (but it is a large file, about 50 MB).
I will write a simple Python script to generate it from the output of lake exe extract_implications

Done. The generated CSV file 

Source,Target,Outcome
Equation1,Equation1,implicit_proof_true
Equation1,Equation2,explicit_proof_false
Equation1,Equation3,explicit_proof_false
...

is approximately 1 GB in size.
Hmm. How large is the repo overall? This might be slightly inconvenient to have in the repo if it is frequently updated.
I won't add it to the repo. I will push the interactive ("asks user input for paths") script that generate the csv.

I have added the **/tmp path to the .gitignore.

If anyone wants to generate the implication graph edge list, they just need to run 

lake exe extract_implications outcomes > data/tmp/outcomes.json

and then 

scripts/generate_edgelist_csv.py

which will return 

Please enter the path to the JSON data file: data/tmp/outcomes.json
Please enter the path to save the CSV file: data/tmp/edge_list.csv

I'm cleaning and fully documenting the script at the moment so there is no ambiguity.

I'll push it in a few minutes.

Summary:

  • edge_list.csv: approximately 1 GB
  • outcomes.json: approximately 500 MB
  • edge_list.csv.zip: approximately 60 MB
  • outcomes.json.zip: approximately 2 MB
Maybe I can upload the zipped files once.
Wouldnâ€™t it be better to modify the extract_implication script to do this directly?

Does everyone prefer to extract the edge list and export that in CSV format?

I wasn't sure about that so I opted for an additional Python script. Feel free to implement it in Lean.
Pietro Monticone has marked this topic as resolved.
